Reviews.Title: “Weekend break with the girls”
Reviews.Author: Jackie K
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent weekend in at the hotel mimosa, rooms very clean some had new bathrooms we were a party of 14 and they accommodated us great. Fantastic location central to everything. Good restaurants on doorstep one directly underneath was fab . Will defo go back -great value for money !!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced place to rest your head - if you bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: Can-Ukie-Dutchie
Reviews.Content: Terrible front desk "service" - unhappy and painfully unhelpful. Worst "breakfast" in Italy - it is listed as a B&B in Trip Advisor so pre-packaged croissants was not what we had thought we paid for. No common room or lounge to sit in. At €120 per night this was the worst value and quality of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location with some but....”
Reviews.Author: teote
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at begin of November 2011. Good sides: -Location, all interesting areas are within walking distance. - I feel safety. - Staffs are friendly . - Appearance of rooms are same with web page views. Newish style. - Beds were comfortable. Bad sides: -No heating in November. ( Reception area was being heated, but not rooms.) -- Room was dirty .They need deep cleaning after summer . - You may hear street noise . I will stay there again if I am sure about heating in Fall/Winter or AC in summer time and cleaning. If you come with the ready mind about budget hotel, you may consider this hotel. Note : its written that hotel is after 8 stops after Termini with bus 64. Its only 4 or 5 stops, Remember Argentina stop.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Katy_travel37
Reviews.Content: This does exactly what it advertises - provides basic accommodation in an amazing location. So if your surroundings is more important to you than your bedroom then stay here! It's about a minute's walk from the Pantheon and has one of the best coffee places in Rome almost next-door (Sant'Eustachio). It's on a gorgeous cobbled narrow street and the sounds of bustling Italian life going on below in the morning is a joy. The rooms are clean. Breakfast is provided, though it won't be one of the highlights of your stay. NB. The building is on the opposite side of the street to where it's number is displayed! Look for the little intercom where it's written. If you have any trouble as the policeman who sits in a box nearby 24/7!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal considering the great location”
Reviews.Author: palghat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights-five days in Room-B (Aug 9-13, 2011), which had an attached bath. Plus points: 1) 50 yards from Pantheon and within 15-20 min walking distance of most major sites. 2) Very inexpensive hotel considering the fantastic location. Don't expect the moon for 95 Euros a day. 3) Plenty of eating places of all kinds (two of the best gellaterias in the area) 4) Quiet, given the location 5) Friendly and helpful staff who speak several languages, including English. Front desk open round the clock (one man insisted that we have breakfast when we checked out at 7 a.m. on the 13th even though breakfast officially starts at 8. He also made us fresh Italian-style coffee since we were coffee connoisseurs). Breakfast laid out includes rolls, croissants, biscotti, butter, jam, meusli, cornflakes, milk, coffee, tea, hot water, orange juice. 6) Recently renovated (???) since toilet fixtures were new in our room. 7) Clean sheets and towels (towels were replaced on second day), soap and shampoo packs daily. Minus: 1) Our room barely had a view -- of a crummy wall opposite. But then, we came there only to sleep at night. Double bed, one extra bed/couch/diwan whatever. So, can sleep three. 2) Shower temperature erratic. One minute it's icy cold, the next minute, it's scalding. Front desk man promptly leaped up to fix it when we pointed it out. Problem continued for the next three days. Sigh. 3) Mimosa accepts only cash even though the website gives the impression that you can pay by credit card. Computer printout on front desk claimed -- and I use this word deliberately -- that they were having problems with the connections and that credit card is only for making reservations. But I'm told by a resident of Rome that a cash-only policy is quite common in pensiones, probably as a tax evasion ploy. Confirm before you make a booking if you cannot pay cash. Cash machines are plentiful near the hotel. Watch out for 19.5 percent commission at cash exchanges though (listed in small print at the bottom of the exchange rates). You might have a problem finding the hotel. It's a dark green door, with a 1ft x 6in metal plate sign just above the listing of all the building's occupants. When facing the Pantheon, walk to the back on the right side of Pantheon, on via della rotunda. go about 25 yards after the pantheon building complex ends.Then turn right on via di santa chiara. It's the second or third green door on the left. The sign is almost invisible. Almost opposite it is a small coffee and sandwich shop that opens usually around 6 a.m. and serves coffee from 7ish. Overall, I'd recommend this for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Girasole40
Reviews.Content: Really I don't know what some people who write these reviews expect when they're paying 90 Euros to stay right in the centre of Rome! Yes it's basic, but I found it to be clean and the staff helpful. The air-con is a real plus too if you're planning a visit in the middle of summer. The location is truly hard to beat. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Showers Orange From Mildew”
Reviews.Author: evil_queen_lisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with a school trip. We had many rooms and all of the showers had orange mildew in them. I went to the local grocery store and bought shower cleaner and cleaned the common shower in the single bathroom myself because it was disgusting. The rooms themselves were very nice, although some people in my group complained that the restaurant below on the street was loud some nights. The floors had not been swept in a while as there were dust bunnies all over. I didn't look too hard for fear of what I would find. Thank goodness I remembered to bring flip flops with me! The wifi was so-so. Often it didn't work at all and you could only access it from the reception area. Breakfast was simple, pre-packaged croissants and bread. Nothing fancy but enough to fill you up. We had to ask for fresh fruit and after a few days they had some oranges and apples. I'd suggest going to the local supermarket on Corso I think it was and buy some fruit for yourself (pick your fruit, remember the bin number, put it on the scale and click the bin number for it to print out a price label). Location was wicked, we spend every night in front of the Pantheon and we walked everywhere (including the Colosseum and Forum), so I would suggest finding somewhere in the same area. I don't know how much the hotel costs or others cost in the area. We had it all included in our course fees. Not based on price, I would say its fine if you don't mind moldy, mildew-filled showers. And I mean FILLED. You could draw pictures on the wall in mildew if you want. Bring shower shoes. My room was room 9. Same hall as the shared bathroom, but had a nice sink in the room and a nice wardrobe. Desk staff were quiet. Didn't speak much. I didn't try to stike up conversation. PS. They list a deal saying 45Euros for 2 people to the airport. Any taxi from the Pantheon area is E40. Don't have the hotel book. We saw another guest get ripped off by the hotel who took his E45 and then the taxi wanted his E40. Just walk to the Pantheon the day before you want to leave at about that time. Arrange with the driver to pick you up at the Mimosa hotel at this time tomorrow. Taxi's can't wait on the street so be ready for them.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Best Kept secret among places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dutchboy3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Mimosa in Rome on 4 or 5 occasions, and have never been disappointed. The location (near the Pantheon) is superb, the prices are very reasonable, and the staff always welcoming and helpful. HM is a no frills place--some rooms have shared baths, the continental breakfast is basic, only one computer for internet, no tv. But it is well maintained and clean. If you are looking for inexpensive, basic housing while in Rome, I cannot recommend Hotel Mimosa highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: alexandrebrasil1971
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: you're not going to find anyplace under 100€ so close to everything. That said, we had problems with room B, such as insects and what seemed a whole wig stuck in the bathtub drain. Point to the staff, they promptly gave us another room when we complained. There's nothing much to be said about the place: it's a basic hotel without any luxuries. The only reason they are worth the price is, undoubtedly, the location. If you want to do most of Rome by foot, you can't do better in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Concierge, Nasty Bathrooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leeya448
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the location and price, for sure, but here's my problem: My friend and I had just finished a 6 week tour of Europe. For the most part, throughout the trip, were were staying in meager accommodations, as we were on a tight budget. From personal experience, I don't expect a communal bathroom to be the cleanest bathroom, but water flooding every time we showered because of rat sized clumps of hair coming up out of the drain was enough to make you want to throw up while showering. I was sick and wanted tea one day, I had the tea, I just needed hot water, and they refused to let me have hot water from their FULL kitchen. They were the rudest most unhelpful concierges I have ever come across. I understand skimping on amenities to lower the price of a hotel, but you never have to skimp on just being a decent person. I am torn because the location is so incredible, if you don't have a lot of time in Rome, are very low maintenance and don't mind being treated badly, Hotel Mimosa would be ideal if sightseeing is your main priority.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: SM-Bombay
Reviews.Content: One of the rare hotels in Europe to offer free wi-fi! Rooms are rather basic but there's a bathroom attached, which is quite functional, and the window looks out onto a (mostly) quiet street behind the Pantheon. The location could not be better! Staff were very friendly. A relatively good deal at about 80 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY for the location, but what a location”
Reviews.Author: lhonor
Reviews.Content: It's almost unfair to rate the Hotel Mimosa because it does a lot of things right...it's in an AMAZING location steps from the Pantheon, it is clean, and the best deal in the neighborhood. We spent a week in Umbria and a week in Florence and stayed only for one night as we were flying out of Rome. I don't think I would have stayed more than a night or two anyway because the "family" room we had was too basic, three beds pushed together on one side and one cot on the other side was too dorm/hostel in which case one would look for a hostel, which I suspect would be cheaper than $155 Euro. Under the same circumstances; short stay, wanting to be centrally located, I would do it again, but any longer than a night or two, for the same price or less, I would rent two rooms in a pensione, where the personal charms of the rooms are usually greater, the service more personal and you might get a little more of a regular neighborhood feel. BUT, while still not a rave, the Hotel Mimosa, was clean, and central and I would give it a "conditional" thumbs up for budget travelers with basic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no - never again”
Reviews.Author: Ayla2010
Reviews.Content: My husband & I - along with our two young daughters - stayed in the quad/family room for two nights in May 2010. We picked it for the ideal location & because it offered the least expensive rates we could find. Our original impressions were good enough - the room & bathroom were a good size, and everything was clean & tidy. The receptionist (while not overly friendly or chatty) did take our bags to the room. Unfortunately, the good stops there...the room opened up to the (very loud) traffic of the street below. And when the air conditioning didn't work (and the reception staff offered no assistance or alternative) we had no choice but to open the windows because it was so warm & stuffy our baby couldn't sleep. The breakfast consisted of four different types of prepackaged breads and some watered-down juice. Although by this point we were familiar with the typical breakfast found in Italy, this was by far the worst we'd encountered. The final straw, though, was when my husband went to pay the bill. It was 7am and he had to wake the receptionist, who didn't so much as grunt (let along make eye contact or thank us) when my husband paid well over €200 for our worst hotel experience ever. I would definitely not recommend this place - pay a bit more and get somewhere worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit dirty and loud”
Reviews.Author: PAHappyCamper
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for four nights in July 2009. First, the location is great (almost next to the Pantheon). It's really nice to stay in the heart of Rome. There is so much nightlife in all the piazzas, it's great to be part of that and be able to take a short walk back to the hotel. BUT, as other reviews have said, it was a bit dirty. Our bathroom smelled like urine and we had to keep the door closed. They didn't clean the shower the whole time we were there. And we never got a fresh towel. I asked for a fresh towel and they said they were out. When we first arrived, there was loud jackhammering from a renovation beside or above our room. It was unbearable. We wanted to rest from our long flight and couldn't. It was also very loud from the street noise. They said they didn't have another room for our first night, but after the first night, they got us another room on an inside couryard and away from the jackhammering - much better. Most of the young people at the desk were very nice. EXCEPT, on our last night, a desk attendent we hadn't seen before asked us to pay for the room (cash only). We counted out the money, and then he asked for more money for himself! I thought this was very strange. I had never seen this person before, he hadn't done anything for us, and it felt like extortion. The breakfast wasn't very good. Hard rolls with packages of butter and jelly. There was an orange colored liquid, but it wasn't orange juice. Maybe Tang or something. Also, I've stayed at other "inexpensive" hotels and had much better experiences. So my comments are not just someone who has 5 star tastes on a 1 star budget. It's such a special experience to spend time in Rome - FIND A NICER PLACE TO STAY. The following is for your information (not a complaint): It is on the 2nd floor (what Americans call the 3rd floor) and there is no elevator. It is not well marked from the street and it is hard to find in the tangle of Roman streets. The hotel did arrange for a cab to pick us up at the airport and bring us right to the hotel, so we didn't have to try to find it. (This cost 45 euros for the two of us - I don't know if that is a good price or not.) One nice thing: They have one computer with Internet Access.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: gohorns1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in what has to be the biggest fleabag hotel in Rome, the Hotel Mimosa. We found the hotel's website and the website totally misrepresents what you are getting. Our room was dirty. Specifically, the floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years, the shower curtain was filthy, the grout in the shower was moldy, and the walls were dirty. When we checked in, we were tired and jet-lagged, and we didn't know where else we could get a room for the next 4 nights, so the management really had us over a barrel. We checked in, went to the room, and went back to the front desk to complain. The person at the desk was sullen and most unhelpful. He told us that if we chose to move, we'd have to pay for that night and the next night. We just decided to suck it up and stay. Also, we had booked a room with a king-sized bed, and we got two twins. Not too great for a 2nd honeymoon, which is what this trip was! The sullen guy at the front desk said that on Monday the maid would make up the beds into a king. Well, this actually happened on Tuesday, and all that was done was to use the same sheets with the two beds pushed together----which we had already done. To top this all off, the room next door to ours was under serious construction. We had plaster dust in our beds from the workers banging on the walls next door, plus we couldn't use our room to take a siesta in the afternoons because the workers were making such a racket next door. We complained about this, too, and we were told that the workers were not to be working from 1:00 to 4:00. That was a huge lie. The workers were there froom 7:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and there was a terrific lot of dust in the hallway, too. Didn't help our allergies. We had to ask for clean towels, too. When we checked out, my husband insisted that the desk clerk call the manager to tell him that we had no intention of paying the full price for our room because we hadn't been able to use it for 1/3 of the day (while the workmen were working), and that we would pay only 2/3 of the amount. The manager said OK. Also, the website had said that the hotel took major credit cards, and when we checked in, the sullen desk clerk told us "cash only." (The good news is that we STILL had a great time in Rome, and went on to have a fabulous time in Venice and Florence----and stayed at two very nice hotels there, the Hotel Al Gamboa in Venice and the Hotel Bellosguardo in Florence.)

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded hostel.”
Reviews.Author: j2dtravels
Reviews.Content: Expectations better met if one thinks of Hotel Mimosa as upgraded hostel. Three flights of stairs to our triple room with bath and one window overlooking dark air shaft. Bath was cramped. Mattresses and pillows were thin. Lighting was dim. No phone in room. No one made our beds during the day. Indifferent staff and stark public areas. Breakfast comprised of dry breads, bottled juice, and thermos coffee. Website photos and positive reviews better than what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: WhitPalmer
Reviews.Content: Honestly, you get much more than what you pay for with this hotel by the location alone, which is literally steps away from the Pantheon and the great neighborhood that surrounds it. I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend while on military leave, and it was pleasant. Sure the bathroom could have been better, but it wasn't disgusting. The rooms are cheerful and clean, even if the blankets were a little worn. The staff was friendly, and my friend and I did not encounter any kind of curfew and we came in very late.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but there's a curfew!”
Reviews.Author: GemskiSheffield
Reviews.Content: The first problem me and my sister encountered when staying at this hotel was that we nearly couldn't find it! It was about 10pm when we arrived, the taxi driver wasn't sure where exactly the hotel was so dropped us off near the Pantheon. We ended up walking past it about three times and in the end we had to ask a policeman! The only sign that it was a hotel was a small gold plaque on the outside. The first room we went into was a large family room, but we only stayed in there one night as they needed the room for someone else- but to be honest I much preferred the new room. It was fairly small but very clean and it had it's own bathroom. The staff were always nice to us (one of the younger members of staff looked like James McAvoy!), the only thing that bothered me was the curfew as I would have liked to stay out longer than midnight ! The strange thing about breakfast was that you almost had to tell the staff that you were ready to have it. They seemed to set the table according to rooms- so when we sat at one table, they would say "Room 4? No you sit on this table". It was basic but you can get a really nice breakfast nearby at any of the cafes on Campo Di Fiori. The location was excellent- we didn't have to get any public transport anywhere, we could walk to all of the major attractions and there was plenty going on at night time around the hotel. It's absolutely fine if you just want to use it as a base!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why the Bad Reviews, Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mousiev
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed just like any of the other budget hotels we stayed at in Italy. The room was clean with two twin beds pushed together. The sheets and blankets were new and clean. The furniture and fixtures were from IKEA. Our window opened up on to the street. Our room just had a sink. We shared the bathroom. I think that the other reviews that are not favorable must have had a bathroom in the room. Which I think is in a different wing of the hotel. Maybe it is older and not as uptodate as the wing we stayed in. We had to bathrooms to choose from. The bathrooms were clean and the showers were fine. Nothing fancy but just fine. The breakfast was very average. But it was sufficient. The location was amazing and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Scot60
Reviews.Content: We picked this Hotel due to it's location which was excellent. Everything else was dreadful. Hotel is on the second floor of a old building, Everything is old, worn or stained. The bathroom we had was fitted with old dirty jacuzzi type bath with a hand held shower. The breakfast we had once but it was so bad we ate in a café near by after that.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: BaileyboyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: There is only one positive thing I can say about this hotel and that is it has a good location. After that I can not say a good work. It appears that this is a money making project with little to nothing going back into the up keep of the facility. Honestly, I do not believe they know how to clean. The floors are dirty! One of the rooms that our party stayed in had dirt and trash under the bed. You can tell that the tile floor had not been washed or cleans in a long time. My room looked more like a room from a house of prostitution. The carpet was deep red placed over loose tiles with a red bed spread. The bed was about 8 inches off the floor. The bathroom was a joke. I have more power in my spit then the shower had. The toilet was lose from the floor. So, you had to go at it slowly or who knows what might happen. The so called breakfast was not a breakfast. They had a basket of hard rolls (hard because they had been around for a while), a piece of pastery that was in plastic, butter, water, coffee, and something that did not look like anything that I have ever drank before. I think it was to be orange juice. Needless to say, it was bad! The people behind the desk were worthless. All they ever seemed to do was grunt when you asked a question. If someone ran this hotel who actually cared about the facility and put some money back into it, it might be a worth while place to stay. But for the actual cost, it was robbery! Too much cost and no service.

Reviews.Title: “terribel”
Reviews.Author: beanUsa
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical after I read the reviews but my son stayed at the Mimosa 2 years ago and said it was an acceptable hotel so I booked it. What a mistake. Our room was filthy, the bathroom was moldy, the 1 blanket in the room had an awful odor. We stayed 2 nights and then left and went to another hotel. We shouldn't have stayed at all. When I made the initial booking the price was $155 Euro/night I then received an e-mail stating that the price was $118. The day before We arrived i got another e-mail stating that they had made a mistake and the price was $155. OK, that's what I had expected to pay but why did the price chnge? The breakfast did not look like it was worth trying. again, the room was filthy. What a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCtek
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the other travelers are referring to....our family recently returned from a 3 day stay at the Mimosa....we were in a family quad room with showers....and OK, so the room was not fancy, but we had beds (4 singles) a bath and shower....the hotel is in an INCREDIBLE LOCATION.....walking distance to the Pantheon, and a little bit farther to the Colusseum and Ruins, but not a bad walk...at all, nice quiet neighborhood.....breakfast was rolls, and juice and coffee and I think yogurt.....it fit our needs our budget, and was in a GREAT LOCATION...albeit, a little hard to find, but worth it !!! We were up in the morning, gone all day and then returned at night. We took the bus (40) from Termini and got off at Calle Argentina, about a 17 minute bus ride...and people on the bus helped us identify where to get off.........I had to ask a neighboring hotel where the Mimosa was as they only have a brass plate on the building, but this is truly in a GREAT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are looking for a basic hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: RoamingLombards
Reviews.Content: Hotel was borderline dumpy but provided the baseline necessities for a really good price in such a prime location (blocks from the Pantheon, close to a bus stop). Frommer's (our resource) was very clear this was not a fancy hotel so my husband and I knew what to expect and were fine with it. I probably wouldn't refer this hotel to friends UNLESS I knew location was very important to them and they were going to be OK with a very basic, no-frills hotel. We had one of the smaller rooms without a bathroom. There was not a lot of extra space in the room but it had what we needed and it was nice to have a sink and faucet in the room since we were showering down the hall. We had two twin beds rather than a double but we soon came to learn this was a trend in Italy. The staff was pleasant enough and gave us a map of the city. Despite Frommer's promise of a hearty American breakfast we received the traditional pastries, bread and coffee. Again, very basic but for the price we couldn't complain. The bathroom was pretty clean and with two of them we rarely had difficulty having access to one of them. Be prepared, the showers are very small (again, another Italian trend as we discovered). At 4' 11" I had no problems but my husband is a bigger guy so it wasn't quite as comfortable. AC worked well which was good as there was a little noise sometimes late at night and early on some mornings. Not bad with the windows shut unless you are a pretty light sleeper. The area seemed clean, safe and there were an assortment of bars (coffee), bakeries, restaurants, wine shops and other stores. Plus, it was fun to sit out in front of the Pantheon for breakfast or a late snack. Overall, it worked well for us. We were hardly there (there is so much to see and do in Rome) and considering the exchange rate was $1.60 for 1 Euro we wanted to spend our money as wisely as possible.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acga
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty, the air was smelly, the sheets were soiled, the bathroom was flooded and filthy. It was a pigsty, and made us feel like animals to be there. HORRIBLE, please avoid the Mimosa.

Reviews.Title: “Kind staff”
Reviews.Author: WAnative
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was perfect for a hot July in Italy. The rooms were average for cheap accomodations in Rome, but the location was wonderful and the staff very friendly. We woke up late for our flight out home. The front desk manager arranged for a last minute shuttle to the airport and kindly let us print our boarding pass. We never tried the breakfast so we can't comment. We totally loved Rome after dark and the hotel location really puts you in the middle of things and allows easy walking to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel at a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: h4nnita
Reviews.Content: Location is amazing and the price is right. But the hotel is old and out dated with smelly communal bathrooms. Breakfast consists of bad coffee, watered down orange juice and bread so don't think you are getting a deal by getting breakfast included in the hotel price. If I was on a tight budget and could reserve a room with a private bath, I would consider staying here again... but probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Location = Great!”
Reviews.Author: KMPBuffalo
Reviews.Content: What a steal! Rome can be VERY expensive, no matter where you look. My husband and I just got back from a 2 week backpacking trip throughout Italy. We ended our tour in Rome, and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Hotel Mimosa is literally RIGHT behind the Pantheon... it made going out at night for gelatto, dinner, nightlife, etc. so enjoyable and convenient. The room was rather dorm-like, but was very clean. The shared bathrooms were for the most part clean and always available. The staff was ALWAYS at the front desk and was very friendly. We were able to arrange door to door car service from the hotel to the airport that was very reasonably priced (and so convenient, as our flight back to the U.S. left very early in the morning... I wouldn't have wanted to deal with the train station at 6am!). Great location, I can't reiterate it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Near Piazza Rotonda and Pantheon, is that enough?”
Reviews.Author: govali99
Reviews.Content: I cannot deny that fact that Hotel Mimosa is centrally located and the staff is very helpful. The hotel is very basic, but since we didn’t stay much in the room that wasn’t a problem. However, I had a double room with a street view and it was very noisy. In the night, the bars and the noise go until midnight. In the morning, the trucks with milk and other supplies start their delivery before 7 am. The worst part of our stay was the low water pressure in the shower. Taking a shower was an adventure, the water alternates at random between cold and hot, and it’s just trickling. After a long day walking the streets of Rome, all I want is a shower and sleep quietly, and that didn’t happen. I guess it depends in what room you stay. The unbeatable point about this hotel is its location. I have fond memories of having gellato sitting on the obelisk steps and gazing at the Pantheon. It’s magnificent. I am not sure I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PGPR
Reviews.Content: While I read the very mixed reviews of the Mimosa before my trip, I booked anyway because I wasn't finding anything else within our price range available and hoped for the best. It actually turned out to be better than I anticipated and I didn't experience any of the problems noted by previous reviewers. Our room was clean (well, a little mold near the ceiling in the shower), the staff was helpful (brought our bags up and down, stayed on the phone and made several attempts to call us a cab when they were all busy) and considering the location and the fact that breakfast is included, I'd consider this a great value in Rome. And, as mentioned, there is no lift, but if my 77-year-old mother could handle the stairs (slowly, at her own pace), I'm sure most anyone else could manage.

Reviews.Title: “second visit a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ngaire
Reviews.Content: The Mimosa is very well situated in Rome as well as being reasonably priced. However important these details might be there are also disadvantages. We stayed in Dec 2005 and were disappointed with the level of cleanliness as well as the very tired bedlinen. Our room was the same one we'd occupied three years previously and the broken window we'd noticed then had still not been replaced. Compared to other places we stayed in Italy the breakfast was below average. The quality of the furnishings is simply not good enough - old, unappealing and falling apart. The same goes for the plumbing and electricity. We'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Second time round and things have changed for the worse”
Reviews.Author: jtandjt
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Mimosa in 2002 and it was a no frills but acceptable experience. We chose to stay there again because of the location - which really is brilliant. Even the 116 (tiny electric bus) stops in the street. This time however we were very disappointed in our stay. Our room was dirty and run-down. There was a packet of condoms left in the bedside drawer and the floor had not been swept in ages! The beds were like camp beds, two singles pushed together, but they were of different heights! The pillows were old and misshapen. My bed had a blanket but my husband's only had a duvet. The room had very eccentric wiring and I didn't risk using my hairdryer. There was only one bedside light - difficult if both of you wanted to read in bed. The bathroom was minimalist. There was a very rude man in charge of the breakfast (he made some disparaging remarks about Americans) which consisted of fresh bread, croissants and jam, tea and coffee. I really feel that, despite the location, there is mush better value to be had in Rome. We returned to Rome at the end of our trip and chose to stay at another hotel which was of a comparable price but infinitely better in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: melissaob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mimosa with my sister in Dec 05 to Jan 06 for five nights. The hotel is in an amazingly central location just three short blocks to the Pantheon in the central historic district. The room we had was across the hall from the main hotel and was extremely quiet and very warm. The bedroom and bathroom were basic but spotlessly clean, both quite large in size. Breakfast was croissants, freshly baked bread rolls, and toast with coffee, tea and orange juice. The down side is that the Mimosa is three flights of stairs up (it is a typical Italian pensione), which can be tiring after a long day of walking. The staff were friendly and helpful and carried our rather large suitcases down for us when we were leaving. I would definitely stay here again and request the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Walls like rice paper!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mimosa in the heart of the old city and close to all attractions is up three flights of stairs. The rooms are sparse - no television and little furniture. The bathroom was tiny and the toilet made a rather amusing but rude sound as it 'farted' when flushed. The walls are paper thin - we were entertained by an amorous couple for the first two nights and then giggly, rude teenagers for the next three. The staff are particulary unfriendly and unhelpful. The stairs were a real pain after a day of walking the streets and with no lift, lugging suitcases up and down was a trial. However, if you can put up with all that I guess the tarrif was kind on the pocket and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed in Italy, the hotels were a bit of a culture shock... the idea of a hotel being inside a larger building and sharing space with apartments, businesses etc was wierd. The mimosa is also part of a larger building. I stayed here with my daughter in June and found the rooms to be quite basic, if you're comparing to resort hotels or the type of hotel you might be used to in England or the States. However - that said, the room was clean, the staff were very friendly, the cost was very reasonable in comparison to other hotels in the city - especially within the centre - the breakfast was lovely, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the guests were from all over the world. The location is very central and everything you want to see is within a short walking distance. I'm going back in November with a friend because I liked it there and I would recomend it to others. If there were any cockroaches, I didn't see them - and of course, being in the thick of things, there is a little noise - but I stayed in another part of Rome before and I couldn't sleep for the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through an old Lonely planet book... but discovered (on our return to North America) that is no longer in the current 2004 book. The hotel is in a fantastic and central location. The price is also cheap for Rome too... but you get what you pay for. We saw a cockroach in the building. The rooms were loud and there were burnt smells (from pizzerias?) outside. The rooms needs renovation. We had very old pillows and bedsheets and the beds were small (seemed smaller than a usual double) and not firm at all. There were breadcrumbs in our room when we checked in. The lock on the door was difficult to use. When we booked, there were no private baths available, so we tried the shared bathroom. One of the toilets didn't flush properly. The shower walls were also extremely dirty - and apparent that they don't wash it for some lengthy period of time. One of the bathroom lock doors was also busted. The place is run down and it doesn't look like they care. Better value can be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went last July and got a good size room with KING bed and A/C for about 100 euro a night and that included our own bathroom & a breaksfast of eggs, which is uncommon, rolls, jelly, etc. It was served in a nice room also. The staff was very pleasant & helpful. I would really recommend staying here if you are looking for a clean, basic, no frills hotel in the center of everything. You can walk out the front door and walk about 3 small blocks and be standing right infront of the Pantheon, it was great. All the other sights are walking distance as well. I would defintley stay here again. Only bummer is that there are 3 flights of stairs to the hotel lobby, so be ready to carry your suitcases.
